page.title: 01Loch Crinan
page.content: Loch Crinan West of Lochgilphead. The Crinan area is situated on the west coast of Argyll about 10-15 miles west of Lochgilphead. Loch Crinan is a sandy and rocky estuary which provides shelter for sailing craft and trawlers. Crinan is a small village that contains a large hotel, cafe, chandlery and boat yard. It is also the start of the Crinan Canal that runs to Ardrishaig, thereby cutting short a very long sea journey round the Mull of Kintyre. It is heavily forested on the hills behind Crinan, planted mostly by the Forestry Commission. Duntrune castle stands to the north of Loch Crinan. It is very old nd inhabited by the owner of te estae. Mostly used for sheep farming. In the summer, the whole area is busy with tourists,particularly Crinan
